docs.snippet: BOARD OF SUPERVISORS.--An adjourned meeting of the Kings County Board of Supervisors was held yesterday afternoon in the County Jail, Raymond-st., Ex-Mayor SMITH in the chair. A communication was received from the keeper of the Penitentiary, with the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF SUPERVISORS.--An adjourned meeting of the Kings County Board of Supervisors was held yesterday afternoon in the County Jail, Raymond-st., Ex-Mayor SMITH in the chair. A communication was received from the keeper of the Penitentiary, with the following report for June: Prisoners received, 91--males 37; females, 54. Discharged-males, 47: females, 46--93. Remaining--males. 117;

docs.snippet: CELEBRATION BY THE GERMAN "GRWERBEVABRIN" IN NEW-YORK.--Not the least interesting and suggestive of the celebrations of the Fourth of July was that by the "Gewerbe Verein," a German Society of the Industrial Arts, incorporated by the Legislature last...
docs.lead_paragraph: CELEBRATION BY THE GERMAN "GRWERBEVABRIN" IN NEW-YORK.--Not the least interesting and suggestive of the celebrations of the Fourth of July was that by the "Gewerbe Verein," a German Society of the Industrial Arts, incorporated by the Legislature last Winter. The fete was arranged and carried out by Germans exclusively, and is one of many proofs that the American national spirit is making its way among that class of our population.

headline.main: Independence Day in the City.; TYPOGRAPHICAL SOCIETY ANNIVERSARY. Fireworks, Fires Accidents, Incidents, Excursions, Expslosions, &c. POW-WOW ATAMMANY. Preccedigs at the Institations. Grand Display of the Military. THE BEGATTA AND ITS SURROUNDINGS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Those of the inhabitants of Manhattan Island, who could not get away from the City, after passing a sleepless night, lightening to the first matterings of Independence Day thunder, were awakened, if we may be permitted to make use of the Hiberalcism, by the filing of cannon, the ranging of bells, the obangor of trumpets,

docs.snippet: The intelligence brought from Southampton by the Vande, bilt on the 22d ult., is not of decisive importance. The fortnight which had elapsed since the battle of Maleguano had not been marked by any active operations, beyond the general advance of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The intelligence brought from Southampton by the Vande, bilt on the 22d ult., is not of decisive importance. The fortnight which had elapsed since the battle of Maleguano had not been marked by any active operations, beyond the general advance of the Allies and the retreat of the Austrians to the position to which the revised plan of the campaign assigns them.

docs.snippet: The Croton Aqueduct Department enjoys the distinguished reputation of being honest. At times, every other limb ot the Municipal Government has been charged with corruptionthis never. It lives close up to its rules,teats its regulations as if they...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Croton Aqueduct Department enjoys the distinguished reputation of being honest. At times, every other limb ot the Municipal Government has been charged with corruptionthis never. It lives close up to its rules,teats its regulations as if they were Median and Persian laws, and religiously conforms to them.

headline.main: THE WAR IN EUROPE.; BRITISH POLITICS. THE ARMAMENT OF PRUSSI A. Cotton Quier--Advance in Breadstuffs and Provisions--Consols 92 3-8@92 1-2, THE STATE OF THE PAPAL DOMINIONS. GARIBALDI AND HIS VOLUNTEERS. Arrival of the Vanderbilt. FOUR DAYS LATER. Imminence of Another Great Battle on the Mincio. THE BATTLE OF CANEDOLO. Official Details of the fight at Malegnano.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Vanderbill, Capt. LBFEVER, from Southampton, June 22, arrived at this port early on Sunday morning. The Steamship Asia arrived at Liverpool on the morning of June 19. The screw steamship Kangaroo arrived at Liverpool, Tuesday morning, June 21.

docs.snippet: ARRIVAL OF THE STEAMSHIP CAHAWBA. The U.S. Mail steamship Cahawba, J. W. SMITH, Commander, from New-Orleans and Havana, arrived here last evening at 7 o'clock, after a very pleasant passage.
docs.lead_paragraph: ARRIVAL OF THE STEAMSHIP CAHAWBA. The U.S. Mail steamship Cahawba, J. W. SMITH, Commander, from New-Orleans and Havana, arrived here last evening at 7 o'clock, after a very pleasant passage.

headline.main: EUROPEAN NEWS.; THE MAILS BY THE ARABIA. HIGHLY INTERESTING CORRESPONDENCE. Details of the Battle of Malegnano. Incidents, Anecdotes and Facts of the War. GENERAL INTELLIGENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mails by the steamship Arabia, from Liverpool, June 18, were received last evening. We enlarge and amend the meagre summary forwarded by telegraph with the letters of our English and Continental Correspondents, and extracts from our European exchanges.
